00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Support functions for managing command queues used for
00044  * various hardware blocks.
00045  *
00046  * The common command queue infrastructure abstracts out the
00047  * software necessary for adding to Octeon's chained queue
00048  * structures. These structures are used for commands to the
00049  * PKO, ZIP, DFA, RAID, HNA, and DMA engine blocks. Although each
00050  * hardware unit takes commands and CSRs of different types,
00051  * they all use basic linked command buffers to store the
00052  * pending request. In general, users of the CVMX API don't
00053  * call cvmx-cmd-queue functions directly. Instead the hardware
00054  * unit specific wrapper should be used. The wrappers perform
00055  * unit specific validation and CSR writes to submit the
00056  * commands.
00057  *
00058  * Even though most software will never directly interact with
00059  * cvmx-cmd-queue, knowledge of its internal workings can help
00060  * in diagnosing performance problems and help with debugging.
00061  *
00062  * Command queue pointers are stored in a global named block
00063  * called "cvmx_cmd_queues". Except for the PKO queues, each
00064  * hardware queue is stored in its own cache line to reduce SMP
00065  * contention on spin locks. The PKO queues are stored such that
00066  * every 16th queue is next to each other in memory. This scheme
00067  * allows for queues being in separate cache lines when there
00068  * are low number of queues per port. With 16 queues per port,
00069  * the first queue for each port is in the same cache area. The
00070  * second queues for each port are in another area, etc. This
00071  * allows software to implement very efficient lockless PKO with
00072  * 16 queues per port using a minimum of cache lines per core.
00073  * All queues for a given core will be isolated in the same
00074  * cache area.
00075  *
00076  * In addition to the memory pointer layout, cvmx-cmd-queue
00077  * provides an optimized fair ll/sc locking mechanism for the
00078  * queues. The lock uses a "ticket / now serving" model to
00079  * maintain fair order on contended locks. In addition, it uses
00080  * predicted locking time to limit cache contention. When a core
00081  * know it must wait in line for a lock, it spins on the
00082  * internal cycle counter to completely eliminate any causes of
00083  * bus traffic.
00084  *
00085  * <hr> $Revision: 137666 $ <hr>
00086  */
00087 
00088 #ifndef __CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_H__
00089 #define __CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_H__
00090 
00091 #include "cvmx-atomic.h"
00092 
00093 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00094 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00095 extern "C" {
00096 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00097 #endif
00098 
00099 /**
00100  * By default we disable the max depth support. Most programs
00101  * don't use it and it slows down the command queue processing
00102  * significantly.
00103  */
00104 #ifndef CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_ENABLE_MAX_DEPTH
00105 #define CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_ENABLE_MAX_DEPTH 0
00106 #endif
00107 
00108 #define NUM_ELEMENTS(arr) (sizeof(arr)/sizeof((arr)[0]))
00109 
00110 /**
00111  * Enumeration representing all hardware blocks that use command
00112  * queues. Each hardware block has up to 65536 sub identifiers for
00113  * multiple command queues. Not all chips support all hardware
00114  * units.
00115  */
00116 typedef enum {
00117     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_PKO_BASE = 0x00000,
00118 #define CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_PKO(queue) ((cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t)(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_PKO_BASE + (0xffff&(queue))))
00119     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_ZIP = 0x10000,
00120 #define CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_ZIP_QUE(queue) ((cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t)(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_ZIP + (0xffff&(queue))))
00121     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_DFA = 0x20000,
00122     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_RAID = 0x30000,
00123     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_DMA_BASE = 0x40000,
00124 #define CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_DMA(queue) ((cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t)(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_DMA_BASE + (0xffff&(queue))))
00125     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_BCH = 0x50000,
00126 #define CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_BCH(queue) ((cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t)(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_BCH + (0xffff&(queue))))
00127     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_HNA = 0x60000,
00128     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_END = 0x70000,
00129 } cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t;
00130 
00131 #define CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_ZIP3_QUE(node,queue) \
00132   ((cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t)((node) << 24 | CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_ZIP | (0xffff&(queue))))
00133 
00134 /**
00135  * Command write operations can fail if the command queue needs
00136  * a new buffer and the associated FPA pool is empty. It can also
00137  * fail if the number of queued command words reaches the maximum
00138  * set at initialization.
00139  */
00140 typedef enum {
00141     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS = 0,
00142     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_NO_MEMORY = -1,
00143     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_FULL = -2,
00144     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_INVALID_PARAM = -3,
00145     CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_ALREADY_SETUP = -4,
00146 } cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t;
00147 
00148 typedef struct {
00149 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00150     /* First 64-bit word: */
00151     uint64_t fpa_pool:16;       /**< FPA1:POOL/FPA3:GAURA for buffers */
00152     uint64_t base_paddr:48;     /**< command buffer physical address */
00153     /* Second 64-bit word: */
00154     int32_t index;          /**< Number of cmd words in buffer */
00155     uint16_t max_depth;     /**< Maximum outstanding blocks */
00156     uint16_t pool_size_m1;      /**< FPA buffer size in dwords - 1 */
00157 #else
00158     /* First 64-bit word: */
00159     uint64_t base_paddr:48;
00160     uint64_t fpa_pool:16;
00161     /* Second 64-bit word: */
00162     uint16_t pool_size_m1;
00163     uint16_t max_depth;
00164     int32_t index;
00165 #endif
00166 } __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_t;
00167 
00168 /**
00169  * command-queue locking uses a fair ticket spinlock algo,
00170  * with 64-bit tickets for endianness-neutrality and
00171  * counter overflow protection.
00172  * Lock is free when both counters are of equal value.
00173  */
00174 typedef struct {
00175     uint64_t ticket;
00176     uint64_t now_serving;
00177 } __cvmx_cmd_queue_lock_t;
00178 
00179 /**
00180  * @INTERNAL
00181  * This structure contains the global state of all command queues.
00182  * It is stored in a bootmem named block and shared by all
00183  * applications running on Octeon. Tickets are stored in a different
00184  * cache line that queue information to reduce the contention on the
00185  * ll/sc used to get a ticket. If this is not the case, the update
00186  * of queue state causes the ll/sc to fail quite often.
00187  */
00188 typedef struct {
00189     __cvmx_cmd_queue_lock_t lock[(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_END >> 16) * 256];
00190     __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_t state[(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_END >> 16) * 256];
00191 } __cvmx_cmd_queue_all_state_t;
00192 
00193 extern CVMX_SHARED __cvmx_cmd_queue_all_state_t *
00194 __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_ptrs[CVMX_MAX_NODES];
00195 
00196 /**
00197  * @INTERNAL
00198  * Internal function to handle the corner cases
00199  * of adding command words to a queue when the current
00200  * block is getting full.
00201  */
00202 extern cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t
00203         __cvmx_cmd_queue_write_raw(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id,
00204             __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_t *qptr,
00205             int cmd_count, const uint64_t *cmds);
00206 
00207 
00208 /**
00209  * Initialize a command queue for use. The initial FPA buffer is
00210  * allocated and the hardware unit is configured to point to the
00211  * new command queue.
00212  *
00213  * @param queue_id  Hardware command queue to initialize.
00214  * @param max_depth Maximum outstanding commands that can be queued.
00215  * @param fpa_pool  FPA pool the command queues should come from.
00216  * @param pool_size Size of each buffer in the FPA pool (bytes)
00217  *
00218  * @return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS or a failure code
00219  */
00220 cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t cvmx_cmd_queue_initialize(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id,
00221                           int max_depth, int fpa_pool,
00222                           int pool_size);
00223 
00224 /**
00225  * Shutdown a queue a free it's command buffers to the FPA. The
00226  * hardware connected to the queue must be stopped before this
00227  * function is called.
00228  *
00229  * @param queue_id Queue to shutdown
00230  *
00231  * @return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS or a failure code
00232  */
00233 cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t cvmx_cmd_queue_shutdown(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id);
00234 
00235 /**
00236  * Return the number of command words pending in the queue. This
00237  * function may be relatively slow for some hardware units.
00238  *
00239  * @param queue_id Hardware command queue to query
00240  *
00241  * @return Number of outstanding commands
00242  */
00243 int cvmx_cmd_queue_length(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id);
00244 
00245 /**
00246  * Return the command buffer to be written to. The purpose of this
00247  * function is to allow CVMX routine access to the low level buffer
00248  * for initial hardware setup. User applications should not call this
00249  * function directly.
00250  *
00251  * @param queue_id Command queue to query
00252  *
00253  * @return Command buffer or NULL on failure
00254  */
00255 void *cvmx_cmd_queue_buffer(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id);
00256 
00257 /**
00258  * @INTERNAL
00259  * Retreive or allocate command queue state named block
00260  */
00261 extern cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t __cvmx_cmd_queue_init_state_ptr(unsigned node);
00262 
00263 /**
00264  * @INTERNAL
00265  * Get the index into the state arrays for the supplied queue id.
00266  *
00267  * @param queue_id Queue ID to get an index for
00268  *
00269  * @return Index into the state arrays
00270  */
00271 static inline unsigned __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_index(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id)
00272 {
00273     /* Warning: This code currently only works with devices that have 256
00274      * queues or less.  Devices with more than 16 queues are laid out in
00275      * memory to allow cores quick access to every 16th queue. This reduces
00276      * cache thrashing when you are running 16 queues per port to support
00277      * lockless operation
00278      */
00279     unsigned unit = (queue_id >> 16) & 0xff;
00280     unsigned q = (queue_id >> 4) & 0xf;
00281     unsigned core = queue_id & 0xf;
00282     return (unit << 8) | (core << 4) | q;
00283 }
00284 
00285 static inline int __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_node(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id)
00286 {
00287     unsigned node = queue_id >> 24;
00288     return node;
00289 }
00290 
00291 /**
00292  * @INTERNAL
00293  * Lock the supplied queue so nobody else is updating it at the same
00294  * time as us.
00295  *
00296  * @param queue_id Queue ID to lock
00297  * 
00298  */
00299 static inline void __cvmx_cmd_queue_lock(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id)
00300 {
00301 #ifndef __U_BOOT__
00302     __cvmx_cmd_queue_lock_t *lock_ptr;
00303     unsigned node;
00304     uint64_t tmp;
00305     uint64_t my_ticket;
00306 
00307     tmp = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_index(queue_id);
00308     node = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_node(queue_id);
00309     lock_ptr = &__cvmx_cmd_queue_state_ptrs[node]->lock[tmp];
00310 
00311     asm volatile (".set push\n"
00312               ".set noreorder\n"
00313               /* Atomic incremebt of 'ticket' with LL/SC */
00314               "1:\n"
00315               "lld     %[my_ticket], %[ticket_ptr]\n"
00316               "daddiu  %[ticket], %[my_ticket], 1\n"
00317               "scd     %[ticket], %[ticket_ptr]\n"
00318               "beqz    %[ticket], 1b\n"
00319               " lld    %[ticket], %[now_serving]\n"
00320               "2:\n"
00321               /* Wait until 'now_serving == ticket' with LL/PAUSE */
00322               "beq    %[ticket], %[my_ticket], 3f\n"
00323               " nop\n pause\n"  /* PAUSE is not allowed in delay slot */
00324               "b      2b\n" /* check now_serving again */
00325               " lld    %[ticket], %[now_serving]\n"
00326               "3:\n"
00327               ".set pop\n"
00328                       : [ticket_ptr] "=m"(lock_ptr->ticket),
00329                       [now_serving] "=m"(lock_ptr->now_serving),
00330                       [ticket] "=&r"(tmp),
00331                       [my_ticket] "=&r"(my_ticket)
00332         );
00333 #endif
00334 }
00335 
00336 /**
00337  * @INTERNAL
00338  * Unlock the queue, flushing all writes.
00339  *
00340  * @param queue_id Queue ID to lock
00341  * 
00342  */
00343 static inline void __cvmx_cmd_queue_unlock(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id)
00344 {
00345 #ifndef __U_BOOT__
00346     __cvmx_cmd_queue_lock_t *lock_ptr;
00347     uint64_t *ns_ptr;
00348     uint64_t ns;
00349     unsigned node;
00350     int tmp;
00351 
00352     /* Order queue manipulation with respect to the unlock.  */
00353     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00354 
00355     tmp = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_index(queue_id);
00356     node = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_node(queue_id);
00357 
00358     lock_ptr = &__cvmx_cmd_queue_state_ptrs[node]->lock[tmp];
00359     ns_ptr = &lock_ptr->now_serving;
00360 
00361     /* Incremebt 'now_sercving to allow next contender in */
00362     ns = (*ns_ptr) + 1;
00363     (*ns_ptr) = ns;
00364 #endif
00365     CVMX_SYNCWS;        /* nudge out the unlock. */
00366 }
00367 
00368 /**
00369  * @INTERNAL
00370  * Initialize a command-queue lock to "unlocked" state.
00371  */
00372 static inline void __cvmx_cmd_queue_lock_init(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id)
00373 {
00374     unsigned index = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_index(queue_id);
00375     unsigned node = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_node(queue_id);
00376 
00377     __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_ptrs[node]->lock[index] =
00378             (__cvmx_cmd_queue_lock_t){0, 0};
00379     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00380 }
00381 
00382 /**
00383  * @INTERNAL
00384  * Get the queue state structure for the given queue id
00385  *
00386  * @param queue_id Queue id to get
00387  *
00388  * @return Queue structure or NULL on failure
00389  */
00390 static inline __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_t *
00391 __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_state(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id)
00392 {
00393     unsigned index;
00394     unsigned node;
00395     __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_t *qptr;
00396 
00397     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00398         if (cvmx_unlikely(queue_id >= CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_END))
00399             return NULL;
00400         if (cvmx_unlikely((queue_id & 0xffff) >= 256))
00401             return NULL;
00402     }
00403     node = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_node(queue_id);
00404     index = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_index(queue_id);
00405 
00406     if (cvmx_unlikely(__cvmx_cmd_queue_state_ptrs[node] == NULL))
00407         __cvmx_cmd_queue_init_state_ptr(node);
00408 
00409     qptr = &__cvmx_cmd_queue_state_ptrs[node]->state[index];
00410     return qptr;
00411 }
00412 
00413 /**
00414  * Write an arbitrary number of command words to a command queue.
00415  * This is a generic function; the fixed number of command word
00416  * functions yield higher performance.
00417  *
00418  * @param queue_id  Hardware command queue to write to
00419  * @param use_locking
00420  *                  Use internal locking to ensure exclusive access for queue
00421  *                  updates. If you don't use this locking you must ensure
00422  *                  exclusivity some other way. Locking is strongly recommended.
00423  * @param cmd_count Number of command words to write
00424  * @param cmds      Array of commands to write
00425  *
00426  * @return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS or a failure code
00427  */
00428 static inline cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t
00429 cvmx_cmd_queue_write(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id, bool use_locking,
00430              int cmd_count, const uint64_t *cmds)
00431 {
00432     cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t ret = CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS;
00433     uint64_t *cmd_ptr;
00434 
00435     __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_t *qptr = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_state(queue_id);
00436 
00437     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00438         if (cvmx_unlikely(qptr == NULL))
00439             return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_INVALID_PARAM;
00440         if (cvmx_unlikely((cmd_count < 1) || (cmd_count > 32)))
00441             return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_INVALID_PARAM;
00442         if (cvmx_unlikely(cmds == NULL))
00443             return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_INVALID_PARAM;
00444     }
00445 
00446     /* Make sure nobody else is updating the same queue */
00447     if (cvmx_likely(use_locking))
00448         __cvmx_cmd_queue_lock(queue_id);
00449 
00450     /* Most of the time there is lots of free words in current block */
00451     if (cvmx_unlikely(
00452         (qptr->index + cmd_count) >= qptr->pool_size_m1)) {
00453         /* The rare case when nearing end of block */
00454         ret = __cvmx_cmd_queue_write_raw(queue_id, qptr,
00455             cmd_count, cmds);
00456     } else {
00457         cmd_ptr = (uint64_t *)cvmx_phys_to_ptr((uint64_t) qptr->base_paddr);
00458         /* Loop easy for compiler to unroll for the likely case */
00459         while (cmd_count > 0) {
00460             cmd_ptr[ qptr->index ++ ] = *cmds++;
00461             cmd_count --;
00462         }
00463     }
00464 
00465     /* All updates are complete. Release the lock and return */
00466     if (cvmx_likely(use_locking))
00467         __cvmx_cmd_queue_unlock(queue_id);
00468     else
00469         CVMX_SYNCWS;
00470 
00471     return ret;
00472 }
00473 
00474 /**
00475  * Simple function to write two command words to a command queue.
00476  *
00477  * @param queue_id Hardware command queue to write to
00478  * @param use_locking
00479  *                 Use internal locking to ensure exclusive access for queue
00480  *                 updates. If you don't use this locking you must ensure
00481  *                 exclusivity some other way. Locking is strongly recommended.
00482  * @param cmd1     Command
00483  * @param cmd2     Command
00484  *
00485  * @return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS or a failure code
00486  */
00487 static inline cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t
00488 cvmx_cmd_queue_write2(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id, bool use_locking,
00489               uint64_t cmd1, uint64_t cmd2)
00490 {
00491     cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t ret = CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS;
00492     uint64_t *cmd_ptr;
00493 
00494     __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_t *qptr = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_state(queue_id);
00495 
00496     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00497         if (cvmx_unlikely(qptr == NULL))
00498             return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_INVALID_PARAM;
00499     }
00500 
00501     /* Make sure nobody else is updating the same queue */
00502     if (cvmx_likely(use_locking))
00503         __cvmx_cmd_queue_lock(queue_id);
00504 
00505     if (cvmx_unlikely((qptr->index + 2) >= qptr->pool_size_m1)) {
00506         /* The rare case when nearing end of block */
00507         uint64_t cmds[2];
00508         cmds[0] = cmd1;
00509         cmds[1] = cmd2;
00510         ret = __cvmx_cmd_queue_write_raw(queue_id, qptr, 2, cmds);
00511     } else {
00512         /* Likely case to work fast */
00513         cmd_ptr = (uint64_t *)cvmx_phys_to_ptr((uint64_t) qptr->base_paddr);
00514         cmd_ptr += qptr->index;
00515         qptr->index += 2;
00516         cmd_ptr[0] = cmd1;
00517         cmd_ptr[1] = cmd2;
00518     }
00519 
00520     /* All updates are complete. Release the lock and return */
00521     if (cvmx_likely(use_locking))
00522         __cvmx_cmd_queue_unlock(queue_id);
00523     else
00524         CVMX_SYNCWS;
00525 
00526     return ret;
00527 }
00528 
00529 /**
00530  * Simple function to write three command words to a command queue.
00531  *
00532  * @param queue_id Hardware command queue to write to
00533  * @param use_locking
00534  *                 Use internal locking to ensure exclusive access for queue
00535  *                 updates. If you don't use this locking you must ensure
00536  *                 exclusivity some other way. Locking is strongly recommended.
00537  * @param cmd1     Command
00538  * @param cmd2     Command
00539  * @param cmd3     Command
00540  *
00541  * @return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS or a failure code
00542  */
00543 static inline cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t
00544 cvmx_cmd_queue_write3(cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue_id, bool use_locking,
00545               uint64_t cmd1, uint64_t cmd2, uint64_t cmd3)
00546 {
00547     cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t ret = CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS;
00548     uint64_t *cmd_ptr;
00549 
00550     __cvmx_cmd_queue_state_t *qptr = __cvmx_cmd_queue_get_state(queue_id);
00551 
00552     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00553         if (cvmx_unlikely(qptr == NULL))
00554             return CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_INVALID_PARAM;
00555     }
00556 
00557     /* Make sure nobody else is updating the same queue */
00558     if (cvmx_likely(use_locking))
00559         __cvmx_cmd_queue_lock(queue_id);
00560 
00561     if (cvmx_unlikely((qptr->index + 3) >= qptr->pool_size_m1)) {
00562     /* Most of the time there is lots of free words in current block */
00563         uint64_t cmds[3];
00564         cmds[0] = cmd1;
00565         cmds[1] = cmd2;
00566         cmds[2] = cmd3;
00567         ret = __cvmx_cmd_queue_write_raw(queue_id, qptr, 3, cmds);
00568     } else {
00569         cmd_ptr = (uint64_t *)cvmx_phys_to_ptr((uint64_t) qptr->base_paddr);
00570         cmd_ptr += qptr->index;
00571         qptr->index += 3;
00572         cmd_ptr[0] = cmd1;
00573         cmd_ptr[1] = cmd2;
00574         cmd_ptr[2] = cmd3;
00575     }
00576 
00577     /* All updates are complete. Release the lock and return */
00578     if (cvmx_likely(use_locking))
00579         __cvmx_cmd_queue_unlock(queue_id);
00580     else
00581         CVMX_SYNCWS;
00582 
00583     return ret;
00584 }
00585 
00586 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00587 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00588 }
00589 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00590 #endif
00591 
00592 #endif /* __CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_H__ */
